Description: The Get-NetUDPSetting cmdlet gets UDP settings for the IP interface. The cmdlet gets the starting port and the number of ports for a dynamic port range that the IP interface uses to send and receive UDP traffic. Use this cmdlet with the Set-NetUDPSetting to specify a dynamic port range to modify. If you do not specify any parameters, the cmdlet gets all dynamic port ranges for UDP from the IP interface.

Examples.Title: Example 1: Get all dynamic port ranges for UDP
Examples.Code:
PS C:\>Get-NetUDPSetting
This command gets all UDP settings. The command gets all dynamic port ranges for UDP from the IP interface.
